item.title: more on Kursk
item.description:
Dara Massicot (@MassDara) on X

Russia begins its response to Ukraine’s incursion into Kursk. Multiple ministries are involved and the command structure is still forming. Someone in Ukraine knew what they were doing and exploited a weak seam in Russian C2. A few important issues to watch: 🧵

URL: https://x.com/MassDara/status/1823058780537733306

item.title: Mass deportation and orphans
item.description:
Richard Hanania (@RichardHanania) on X

Mass deportation would create 4.5 million new orphans. It won’t happen, but what’s interesting here is that while most kinds of people try to act more humane than they actually are in practice, for nationalists cruelty is what they emphasize.

URL: https://x.com/RichardHanania/status/1823000900241404386

item.title: use ChatGPT to estimate true male height
item.description:
Justine Moore (@venturetwins) on X

The girls are using ChatGPT to see if men are lying about their height on dating apps. Upload 4 pictures, it uses proportions and surroundings to estimate height. I tested it on 10 friends & family members - all estimates were within 1 inch of their real height 🤯

URL: https://x.com/venturetwins/status/1822682396090937538?s=48

# RLHF is just barely RL Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) is the third (and last) major stage of training an LLM, after pretraining and supervised finetuning (SFT). My rant on RLHF is that it is just barely RL, in a way that I think is not too widely

item.title: Ozempic is most prominent in Bowling Green, Kentucky
item.description:
Shelly Banjo (@sbanjo) on X

What happens when Ozempic takes over your town? We crunched the data to see which zip code has the highest percentage of the population on these drugs. Turns out, America’s weight-loss drug capital isn’t Hollywood or Manhattan. It’s Bowling Green, Kentucky https://t.co/hseLb3eDH7

item.title: Revisions on the El Salvador murder rate?
item.description:
Whyvert (@whyvert) on X

In El Salvador, Bukele claims to have reduced the murder rate to just 2.4 homicides per 100,000 people. “The data suggests that the real murder rate was 4.5 in 2023” OK, but 4.5 is still a good achievement. (The US rate is 5.5 in 2023, 6.3 in 2022.)

URL: https://x.com/whyvert/status/1822095682661978416

source: Sunday assorted links

item.description:
rohit (@krishnanrohit) on X

item.title: Amjad Masad (@amasad) on X
item.description:
Amjad Masad (@amasad) on X

A big reason why LLMs turned out to be especially good for developers has nothing to do with code. Coding is one heck of a fiddly job. Half the challenge is finding a 9-year-old Reddit comment that solves your issue. Few jobs are like this, which is the sweet spot for LLMs.

URL: https://x.com/amasad/status/1821272657482101066

item.title: Pro-progress will win when it wins women
item.description:
When I started my undergraduate studies in 2016 in the UK, the gender wage gap was a prominent topic among the civically-minded and well-intentioned. It was uncommon to go to an event organized by a women-focused society (think Oxford Women in Business) and not have it mentioned at least once…

URL: https://www.writingruxandrabio.com/p/pro-progress-will-win-when-it-wins?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Links to Consider, 8/12

item.title: What do Women Want? Profit vs Purpose
item.description:
Choice of college major is a major driver of the gender pay gap. This accounts for a whopping 63% of the entry pay gap for college graduates in the US (and 51% in Italy). Young men are consistently choosing fields of study that lead to higher earnings…

URL: https://www.ggd.world/p/what-do-women-want-profit-vs-purpose?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Links to Consider, 8/12

item.title: A Q&A on sadness and social justice fundamentalism in ‘Plain English’
item.description:
I recently appeared on “Plain English with Derek Thompson” to discuss “The Coddling of the American Mind” and how what Tim Urban calls “social justice fundamentalism,” otherwise called “wokeness,” affects mental health. Readers will recall my May 21 ERI post…

URL: https://greglukianoff.substack.com/p/a-q-and-a-on-sadness-and-social-justice?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Links to Consider, 8/12
